result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynn M Dederich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 07-01-2015.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
Provide DNA Sample, immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Sentencing hearing on April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lynn M Dederich in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Colloquy.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Defense requests a new date for sentencing.  No objection by the State.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Lynn M Dederich in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant not to be issued.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

File was not done on the record.
Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Lynn M Dederich did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosario advised court that he met with his client on October 30, 2014, but can not explain why she is not in court today. State requests a capias be issued and Attorney Rosario requests a stayed capias. Court authorizes issuance of a capias, but stays it until the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Lynn M Dederich in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
